abstract: French police officers Sebastien Gaillemin and Stephanie Klein are acquitted in 2005 deaths of teenagers Zyed Benna and Bouna Traore, who were electrocuted in Paris suburb after hiding from police in electrical substation; deaths had prompted violent protests across country.
lead_paragraph: A French court acquitted the two police officers of charges that they had failed to prevent the electrocution of two teenagers in a suburb of Paris nearly 10 years ago.

headline.main: French Officers Acquitted in Deaths That Incited 2005 Unrest
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; France: Officers Are Acquitted in Deaths That Led to Violent Protests in 2005

snippet: A French court acquitted the two police officers of charges that they had failed to prevent the electrocution of two teenagers in a suburb of Paris nearly 10 years ago.
